patch 8.2.1847: Vim9: using negative value for unsigned type

Problem:    Vim9: using negative value for unsigned type.
Solution:   Use zero instead of -1.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1847: Vim9: using negative value for unsigned type · vim/vim@209f020
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1847: Vim9: using negative value for unsigned type · vim/vim@209f020
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: using negative value for unsigned type. Solution: Use zero instead of -1.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/fbbcd00367e1a4fafd047d42ffce0e5dce88925c|patch 8.2.1846: Vim9: block variables are not found in compiled function>
patch 8.2.1846: Vim9: block variables are not found in compiled function

Problem:    Vim9: variables declared in a local block are not found in
            when a function is compiled.
Solution:   Look for script variables in sn_all_vars.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1846: Vim9: block variables are not found in compiled function · vim/vim@fbbcd00
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1846: Vim9: block variables are not found in compiled function · vim/vim@fbbcd00
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: variables declared in a local block are not found in when a function is compiled. Solution: Look for script variables in sn_all_vars.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/8d739de43b84ef7817b3b5b826d1cbfe7572a62a|patch 8.2.1845: Vim9: function defined in a block can't use block var…>
patch 8.2.1845: Vim9: function defined in a block can't use block variables

Problem:    Vim9: function defined in a block can't use variables defined in
            that block.
Solution:   First step: Make a second hashtab that holds all script variables,
            also block-local ones, with more information.
